children.name: climbing plant
children.definition: (= one that grows up things )
examples: The wall was covered with climbing plants.

children.name: succulent
children.definition: specialized a plant such as a cactus in which the leaves and stem are thick and can store a lot of water : cây mọng nước (xương rồng)
examples: Succulents often have thick waxy cuticles to minimize water loss.

children.name: creeping plant
children.definition: a plant that grows along the ground : cây thân bò
examples: creeper[ C ] a plant that grows along the ground, or up walls or trees : cây thân bò

children.name: woody
children.definition: describes plants with hard stems: thân gỗ
examples: The garden was overgrown with woody plants such as hawthorn and bramble.

children.name: vegetable
children.definition: a plant that is eaten raw or cooked, such as a cabbage, a carrot, or peas :
examples: freshfruit and vegetables
organic methods ofgrowing vegetables
vegetable soup
a neatvegetable garden
Vitamin A is found in liver andgreen vegetables.
salad vegetables(= vegetables such as lettuce or tomato es eaten raw )
Grammar
Vegetableis a countable noun, not an uncountable noun :
They grew their own vegetables (NOT their own vegetable).
frozenpackets of frozen vegetables

children.name: fresh
examples: Fresh vegetables taste best immediately after they've been picked.

children.name: raw
examples: Some vegetables are better eaten raw.

children.name: organic
children.definition: grown without using chemicals
examples: Most supermarkets sell organic fruit and vegetables.

children.name: tinned/canned
examples: Do canned vegetables have as many vitamins as fresh ones?

children.name: green vegetables
examples: Eat plenty of green vegetables.

children.name: leafy vegetables
examples: Leafy vegetables contain iron, which is good for the blood.

children.name: root vegetables
children.definition: vegetables whose roots you eat, such as carrots
examples: Excellent soups can be made from root vegetables.

children.name: a salad vegetable
children.definition: a vegetable that is eaten raw in a salad
examples: You can buy ready-prepared salad vegetables.

children.name: baby vegetables
children.definition: vegetables that have not grown to their full size
examples: Baby vegetables, especially carrots and corn, appeal to youngsters.

children.name: vegetable soup
examples: I think I'll have the vegetable soup.

children.name: vegetable stock
children.definition: a liquid in which vegetables have been cooked
examples: Gently cook the mushrooms and onions in the vegetable stock.

children.name: vegetable oil
examples: She uses vegetable oil instead of lard.

children.name: a vegetable garden/patch/plot
examples: Anna was digging in the vegetable garden.

children.name: grow vegetables
examples: If we had a garden, we could grow our own vegetables.

children.name: shade tree
children.definition: US a tree that is planted to provide shade : cây bóng mát

children.name: cereal
children.definition: a plant grown to produce grain, for example wheat, rice etc: cây lấy hạt
examples: cereal crops

children.name: root crop
children.definition: a plant such as potatoes that is grown because its roots are eaten : cây ăn củ

children.name: fruit tree
children.definition: a tree that produces fruit that can be eaten : cây ăn trái
examples: Fruit trees such as apples and pears can be pruned during the winter months.

children.name: herb
children.definition: a type of plant whose leaves are used in cooking to give flavour to particular dishes, or which are used in making medicine : thảo mộc
examples: dried/fresh herbs
Basil, oregano, thyme and rosemary are all herbs.
A large range of herbsand spicesare used in South Asian cookery.
herbal[adj]relating to or made from herbs
herbal tea
herbal cigarettes/remedies

children.name: flower
children.definition: a small plant that produces beautiful flowers : cây hoa
examples: He wasn’t interested in growing flowers in the garden.

children.name: lovely/pretty/beautiful
examples: They admired the lovely flowers in the garden.

children.name: rare
examples: A number of rare flowers grow in these woods.

children.name: dead
examples: There were dead flowers in a vase of green water.

children.name: a wild flower
examples: The meadows were covered with wild flowers.

children.name: a garden flower
examples: Dahlias have become one of the best loved garden flowers.

children.name: an exotic flower
examples: We grow exotic flowers from all over the world.

children.name: a spring/summer/autumn/winter flower
examples: The mountainsides were blanketed with spring flowers.

children.name: cut flowers
examples: Make cut flowers last longer by changing the water in the vase.

children.name: dried flowers
examples: She had brightened up the room with a vase of dried flowers.

children.name: a silk flower
examples: She wore a huge silk flower in her hair.

children.name: flowers grow
examples: Flowers were growing along the side of the road.

children.name: grow flowers
examples: He grows flowers as well as vegetables.

children.name: pick flowers
examples: I'll pick some flowers to put on the table.

children.name: a bunch of flowers
examples: He gave me a lovely bunch of flowers.

children.name: a bouquet of flowers
children.definition: a large bunch of flowers that is given to someone
examples: The bride held a bouquet of flowers.

children.name: a flower shop
examples: He used to run a flower shop.

children.name: a flower pot
examples: The terrace was covered in flower pots.

children.name: a flower bed
children.definition: an area for growing flowers in a garden
examples: The flower beds had been weeded.

children.name: annual
children.definition: a plant which grows, produces seeds, and dies within one year : cây một năm/ một mùa

children.name: biennial
children.definition: a plant that lives for two years, producing seeds and flowers in its second year : cây hai năm

children.name: perennial
children.definition: a plant that lives for several years : cây lâu năm
examples: Roses and geraniums are perennials, flowering year after year.

children.name: early
children.definition: early flowers and vegetables are ones that are ready before ordinary ones :

children.name: hardy
children.definition: describes a plant that can live through the winter without protection from the weather : chịu rét
examples: a hardy perennial

children.name: tender
children.definition: describes plants which are easily damaged by cold weather : chịu rét kém

children.name: grower
children.definition: a plant that grows and develops in a particular way : cây trồng
examples: The new varieties of wheat are good growers even in poor soil.

children.name: a fast/ slow etc grower
examples: Bamboo is a very vigorous grower.

children.name: dicotyledon
children.definition: specialized a plant that produces flowers and has two cotyledons (= leaf parts inside the seed) which develops broad leaves with veins : cây hai lá mầm
examples: dicotyledonous[adj]

children.name: monocotyledon
children.definition: specialized a plant that produces flowers and has only one cotyledon (= leaf part inside the seed) and which usually develops long narrow leaves with parallel veins, for example the daffodil, grasses, and grains such as wheat : cây một lá mầm

children.name: rattan
children.definition: nounspecialized dây mây; cây song
examples: a tropical climbing plant with thin, tough stems

children.name: seedling
children.definition: a very young plant which has grown from a seed : cây con
examples: Raisethe seedlings in the greenhouse.

children.name: moss
children.definition: a very small green plant that grows in a thick soft furry mass on wet soil, trees, or rocks : rêu
examples: The rocks near the river were covered with moss.
mossy[adj]
a mossy tree/ rock/ lawn

children.name: legume
children.definition: specialized a plant that has its seeds in a pod, such as the bean or pea : cây họ đậu
examples: leguminous[adj]
leguminous plants

children.name: weed
children.definition: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly : cỏ dại

children.name: the constant battle against weeds
examples: She was pulling up weeds in her garden.
Herbicides can be used to prevent and control weeds.
